data.enText: a person who invites guests to a meal, a party, etc. or who has people staying at their house

data.chText: 主人伊恩把我们介绍给了其他客人。
data.enText: Ian, our host, introduced us to the other guests.

data.chText: 东道主；主办国（或城市、机构）
data.enText: a country, a city or an organization that holds and arranges a special event

data.chText: 学院正在接待一批来访的俄罗斯科学家。
data.enText: The college is playing host to a group of visiting Russian scientists.
a person who introduces a television or radio show, and talks to guests
an animal or a plant on which another animal or plant lives and feeds
a large number of people or things
the main computer in a network that controls or supplies information to other computers that are connected to it

data.chText: 从主机向你的本地机传送文件
data.enText: transferring files from the host to your local computer
the bread that is used in the Christian service of Communion , after it has been blessed
to organize an event to which others are invited and make all the arrangements for them

data.chText: 德国主办了世界杯决赛。
data.enText: Germany hosted the World Cup finals.

data.chText: 主持（电视或广播节目等）
data.enText: to introduce a television or radio programme, a show, etc.

data.chText: 作为主人组织（聚会）；做东
data.enText: to organize a party that you have invited guests to

data.chText: （通常收费在与互联网连接的计算机上）存储网站
data.enText: to store a website on a computer connected to the Internet, usually in return for payment

data.chText: 在互联网上建立并存储电子商务网站的公司
data.enText: a company that builds and hosts e-commerce sites

means: 主持(电视或广播节目等)

tr: an animal or plant that nourishes and supports a parasite
it does not benefit and is often harmed by the association
(computer science) a computer that provides client stations with access to files and printers as shared resources to a computer network
any organization that provides resources and facilities for a function or event
example: Atlanta was chosen to be host for the Olympic Games

tr: the owner or manager of an inn
a person who invites guests to a social event (such as a party in his or her own home) and who is responsible for them while they are there
(medicine) recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor
a person who acts as host at formal occasions (makes an introductory speech and introduces other speakers)
be the host of or for

value.def: The host at a party is the person who has invited the guests and provides the food, drink, or entertainment.

example.ex: Apart from my host, I didn't know a single person there...
example.tran: 除了主人外，那里的人我一个也不认识。

example.ex: Tommy Sopwith was always the perfect host.
example.tran: 汤米·索普威斯对人一向热情款待。

value.def: If someone hosts a party, dinner, or other function, they have invited the guests and provide the food, drink, or entertainment.

example.ex: Tonight she hosts a ball for 300 guests.
example.tran: 今晚她做东举办一场有300名客人参加的舞会。

example.ex: ...a banquet hosted by the president of Kazakhstan.
example.tran: 哈萨克斯坦总统举行的宴会

value.tran: 作为主人组织，做东举办（聚会等）

value.def: A country, city, or organization that is the host of an event provides the facilities for that event to take place.

example.ex: Barcelona was chosen to be host of the 1992 Olympic games.
example.tran: 巴塞罗那获选为1992年奥运会的主办城市。

example.ex: ...a preliminary qualifying tournament in Andorra involving the host country.
example.tran: 在安道尔举行的有东道国参加的预选资格赛

value.tran: （某项活动的）主办国（或城市、机构）

value.def: If a country, city, or organization hosts an event, they provide the facilities for the event to take place.

example.ex: Cannes hosts the annual film festival.

value.def: If a person or country plays host to an event or an important visitor, they host the event or the visit.

example.ex: In 1987 Canada played host to the Commonwealth Conference...
example.tran: 1987年加拿大主办了英联邦大会。

example.ex: The Prime Minister played host to French Premier Jacques Chirac.
example.tran: 首相接待了法国总理雅克·希拉克。

value.def: The host of a radio or television show is the person who introduces it and talks to the people who appear in it.

example.ex: I am host of a live radio programme.
example.tran: 我是一个电台直播节目的主持人。

value.def: The person who hosts a radio or television show introduces it and talks to the people who appear in it.

example.ex: She also hosts a show on St Petersburg Radio.
example.tran: 她还在圣彼得堡电台主持一个节目。

value.def: A host of things is a lot of them.

example.ex: A host of problems may delay the opening of the Channel Tunnel...
example.tran: 可能推迟英吉利海峡隧道开通的问题一大筐。

example.ex: Today we have radios, TVs, and a whole host of gadgets powered by electricity.
example.tran: 今天我们有收音机、电视机和一大堆小型电器。

value.def: If an area is host to living things, those creatures live and feed in that area.

example.ex: Uganda's beautiful highlands are host to a wide range of wildlife.
example.tran: 乌干达美丽的高地是众多野生动物的栖息地。

value.def: A host or a host computer is the main computer in a network of computers, which controls the most important files and programs.
The host of a parasite is the plant or animal which it lives on or inside and from which it gets its food.

example.ex: When the eggs hatch the larvae eat the living flesh of the host animal.
example.tran: 当卵孵化后，幼虫取食寄主的鲜肉。

value.def: The Host is the bread which is used to represent the body of Christ in Christian church services such as Holy Communion.
value.tran: 圣体（基督教圣餐礼等宗教仪式中代表耶稣躯体的面饼）

trans: 东道国；侨居国；主权国；所在国
寄宿家庭；接待家庭；东道家庭
主岩；母岩；围岩；称为围岩；寄主岩
主機名稱；计算机名；主機名；主机名字；主机名
远程主机；远端主机；远程计算机；长途主机
（宿）主机（当一台计算机A仿真另一台计算机B时；称A机为宿主机）
主机系统；主系統；系统；主系统；宿主机系统
主机地址；主機位址；服务器地址；主机位址；位的主机地址

partsOfSpeech.dec: hospit 客人 + able …的 → 好客的
hospit 客人 + al 表名词 → 把病人当客人的地方 → 医院

partsOfSpeech.d: 主人（原意指招待客人的人）

partsOfSpeech.dec: host 客人 + age 表行为 → 把客人〔留住〕→ 人质
host 客人 + el 表地点 → 客人住的地方 → 旅馆
host 客人 + ess 表女性 → 女主人
